page.title: 05RIDDLESWORTH CHURCH
page.content: St. Peter's Church, Riddlesworth belongs to the parish with Gasthorpe and Knettishall which is served by one vicar who has four other parishes. The vicar has served here for just over one year. He gives seven services weekly plus about ten christenings, marriages and funerals yearly. About 100 people live in the parish, but only a handful attend services. Riddlesworth Church has a larger congregation during term time when all Riddlesworth Hall School attend services each Sunday. This helps to keep the church open. The nave and tower are both Norman 14th century and now in need of repair. The Church Council is responsible for the churches' maintenance. The church has a voluntary treasurer who is respons- ible for overseeing the finances and collection, and an organist.
